result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J. Hach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  6 months county jail with huber, stayed for 60 days.  The Court does not oppose sentence being served on electronic monitoring. 

1 set of costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Def to pay child support as ordered in the family case.  Def to submit DNA sample today at RCSD.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.  Contact with the victim to be determined by the probation agent.

timeConds.notes: With huber.  EM allowed if sheriff okays.  Stayed for up to 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Hach

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
RCSD DISPO OF WARRANT OR COMMITMENT
TIME SERVED

Defendant Travis J. Hach in court with attorney Araysa Marie Simpson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court of the parties' agreement for resolution; ask for amendment to causing harm to child per 948.04(1); proposed dispo calls for probation with conditional jail time and other conditions.  Def pleads guilty to the charge, as amended.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel and Def address the Court.  Court withholds sentence for 7 1/2 years probation.  Conditions:  6 months county jail with huber, stayed for 60 days.  1 set of costs.  Def to pay c. support.  Def to submit DNA sample today at RCSD.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.  Contact with the victim to be determined by the probation agent.  Felony admonishments provided.
